newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Aug 22.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Aug 22.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Thursday morning.
** India and the U.S. sign agreement to work jointly on energy sector projects which could translate into huge American investments in India
** Government decides to allow 100 percent foreign equity holdings in coal, hydro-based power projects

** Foreign funds holding in Indian firms will exceed 24 ceiling when their investments in global depositary receipts are converted into underlying India stock, finance ministry says, the Economic Times reports
** Banks and several local institutions in Bombay closed for local holiday
** Indian stock markets rose for the second straight day on Wednesday helped by local and foreign institutional buying and seen holding gains
** The 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index rose 90.16 points, or 2.72 percent, to 3,406.22
** The 100-share National index gained 35.06 points, or 2.31 percent, to 1,551.26
** The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index ended 22.0 points higher at 999
** The 500-share CRISIL edged up 13.44 points to 680.27
** The Delhi share index gained 21.88 points to 795.74
** The Calcutta index rose 8.83 points to 450.36
** The Madras index rose 41.53 points to 3,570.44
** The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index rose 2.87 points, or 4.14 percent, to 72.25 with the premium over the local market at 10.86 percent compared with Tuesday's 9.32
